headline: Exxon’s New Ally in Fight With Activists: Its Own Retail Investors
summary: Individual investors will be asked to cast their proxy votes in alignment with the company on shareholder proposals.

raw.headline: Exxon’s New Ally in Fight With Activists: Its Own Retail Investors
raw.summary: Individual investors will be asked to cast their proxy votes in alignment with the company on shareholder proposals.

headline: Exxon to offer auto-voting to counter shareholder activism
summary: Exxon Mobil is introducing a unique shareholder voting mechanism that will allow retail investors to automatically cast ballots in step with board recommendations during annual meetings, a move that may help the top U.S. oil producer fend off activist campaigns.  On Monday, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said in a letter that it would not object to the plan from Exxon as long as the company met certain conditions, including providing annual reminders to investors who opted into the mechanism about their participation.  Several activists said they worry the new option could give Exxon an unfair edge in corporate elections.

raw.headline: Exxon to offer auto-voting to counter shareholder activism

On Monday, the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said in a letter that it would not object to the plan from Exxon as long as the company met certain conditions, including providing annual reminders to investors who opted into the mechanism about their participation.  Several activists said they worry the new option could give Exxon an unfair edge in corporate elections.

headline: China's Sinopec clinches top spot in ICIS Top 100 Chemical Companies
summary: China-based Sinopec has become the world's largest chemical company in the newly released ICIS Top 100 Chemical Companies, an annual global ranking of the leading chemical producers.
